Modulation of sensorimotor rhythms (SMR) was suggested as a control signal for brain-computer interfaces (BCI).
Sensorimotor rhythm (SMR) based Brain-Computer Interfaces (BCI) typically require lengthy user training.

All brain-computer interface (BCI) groups that have published results of studies involving a large number of users performing BCI control based on the voluntary modulation of sensorimotor rhythms (SMR) report that BCI control could not be achieved by a non-negligible number of subjects (estimated 20% to 25%).
